Posts.Content: Oct 4, 2018 11:02AM Rae7200 wrote: Yes, but get your medical oncologist’s OK. I use 3x/week or I get so dry I have trouble walking. In between doses, I use a cocoa butter oil from CVS, and my gyn has also recommended “Uber Lube” which I haven’t tried yet.
Posts.Title: Vagifem for dryness Prairietwin2 VL22

Posts.Content: Sep 7, 2018 12:17AM - edited Sep 7, 2018 12:19AM by Rae7200 Hi Pooki, Don't know if this will help. Here's my story. I recently had a recurrence after 3 yrs and 1 week. It showed up when I went for my annual diagnostic mammogram. They did the ultrasound guided biopsy, which really looked bad. We were pretty sure it was cancer even before we got the path report back. What we didn't know, and wouldn't know until the surgery, was whether it was a mass or a lymph node. It turned out to be lymph node — the cancer had completely replaced the lymph in the node. It was in the axilla. I had had a PET scan earlier, and also had an MRI
Posts.Title: Help! Confusion in Diagnosis/Staging Pooki WinningSoFar

Posts.Content: Sep 5, 2018 12:29AM Rae7200 wrote: Johns Hopkins in Baltimore MD is excellent. I live an hour away and it’s worth it to me to go up there. I’d been getting my mammograms there for about 10-12 years when they discovered my BC in a routine mammogram. Doctors, nurses, staff, all wonderful. They are used to dealing with people who come in from all over the world. I did my radiation at the Greenspring campus. Go to their website or look up johns hopkins breast cancer and go from there. Or try the ask an expert johns hopkins breast cancer site. Search for Lillie Shockley. I’m not sure if I spelled her name correctly.
